page.title: 02GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area consists of a flat plateau rising to 377m near Brendon Hill, virtually the whole area being over 300m high although there are a few small valleys. The roads are narrow and edged with the traditional Devon banks - high banks of soil sometimes with beech trees growing in them. The fields are mostly small and these are also edged with beech although the exposed nature of the area means that these trees are usually small. There are no villages and the only occupation other than farming is in the running of a small camp site and caravan club park near Duns stone in the summer.
